frameDefinitions: An Item is located on a Scale relative to a critical value which is determined by some Enabled_situation.
An Agent initiates the beginning of an ongoing Activity in which he will be continuously involved. '' 'At the same time, city-states began to grow in influence on the southern Greek mainland.'
The size of an Entity is assessed in terms of the Degree by which it deviates from the norm.
This frame contains transparent nouns (and some adjectives) denoting quantities of a Mass or of Individuals.
A Location is filled or covered with the Theme.
A member or members of a Class have just been  mentioned or are present in the discourse setting and now a different instance  (or group of instances) of the same class is referred to.
frameExamples: At the same time, city-states <t>began</t> to grow in influence on the southern Greek mainland.
He found them in the <t>deluge</t> of papers on his desk.
The waters of the bay <t>teemed</t> with fish.
My husband left me for <t>another</t> woman -- and now wants to get back together again!
listRoleDefinitions: The entity whose scalar property is specified.
The <fen>Scale</fen> is the attribute of the <fen>Item</fen> that is being described.
This role identifies the <fen>Enabled_situation</fen> by which the critical value is judged.
This role identifies the <fen>Activity</fen> that an <fen>Agent</fen> starts.
This role identifies the being that starts the intentional <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> starts an <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Agent</fen> starts an <fen>Activity</fen>.
The thing whose size is being considered.
The feature of an (actual or possible) <fen>Entity</fen> that is measured. In literal examples, it essentially must be size, or a word equivalent to size such as bulk.
A substance that is being quantified.
The <fen>Theme</fen> covers or fills the <fen>Location</fen>.  This role most frequently occurs in a PP Complement headed by with or in.
<fen>Location</fen> is the object or area that the <fen>Theme</fen> fills or covers.  This frame element generally occurs as the External Argument.
The period of time during which the the Abounding_with event occurs.
The general category of entity which has been referred to.
The instance of the <fen>Class</fen> that is added to the <fen>Initial_set</fen> of entities in the <fen>Class</fen>.
The previously mentioned group of entities of the <fen>Class</fen>.
listRoleExamples: It was <fex>hot</fex> enough to ignite the iron.
Can He make a rock too heavy <fex>for Him to lift</fex>?
The particles were smaller <fex>in size</fex> than expected .
A modicum <fex>of seepage on the floor</fex> is to be expected.
A number <fex>of concerned citizens</fex> have raised objections.
The waters of the bay teemed <fex>with fish</fex>.
<fex>The walls</fex> crawled with nanite surveillance probes.
My Husband left me for another <fex>man</fex>!
A further five incursions <fex>over and above those noted for 1995</fex> took place in the first three months of 1996.

passageCandidateSpans.text: Section 5 of The Public Order Act

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Section 5 of the Public Order Act
Section 4A of the Public Order Act
section 5 of The Public Order Act
the House of Lords amendment 343A of the Bill
